ns8:component-version-script.script:
#!/bin/bash # Import global conf . $global_conf
export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin set -e
# Tested on CentOS if [ -x /usr/sbin/selinuxenabled ] && /usr/sbin/selinuxenabled; then # SELinux can be disabled by setting "/usr/sbin/setenforce Permissive" echo 'SELinux in enabled on this VM template. This service requires SELinux to be disabled to install successfully' exit 1 fi
if [ "x$OS" != "x" ] && [ $OS = 'Ubuntu' ]; then # Fix the linux-firmware package export DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive apt-get install -y linux-firmware < /dev/console > /dev/console # Install MySQL package apt-get install -y mysql-server else yum --nogpgcheck --noplugins -y install mysql-server fi

meta-tag-type.name: OS Family
meta-tag-type.description: Operating System (OS) Family.

supported-os-details.exec-script: trap "APPDEXITSTATUS=\$?;printenv > $2;exit $APPDEXITSTATUS" EXIT # Execute action script source $1 APPDRETURNSTATUS=$? # Unset trap trap - EXIT # Save env variables in output properties file printenv > $2 exit $APPDRETURNSTATUS

ns8:component-version-script.script:
#!/bin/bash # Import global conf . $global_conf
export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin set -e
# Locate the my.cnf file my_cnf_file= if [ -f /etc/my.cnf ]; then my_cnf_file=/etc/my.cnf elif [ -f /etc/mysql/my.cnf ]; then my_cnf_file=/etc/mysql/my.cnf fi
if [ "x$my_cnf_file" = "x" ]; then echo "Neither /etc/my.cnf nor /etc/mysql/my.cnf can be found, stopping configuration" exit 1 fi
# update mysql configuration to handle big packets sed -ie "s/\[mysqld\]/\[mysqld\]\n\ max_allowed_packet=1024M/g" $my_cnf_file # update listening port sed -ie "s/\[mysqld\]/\[mysqld\]\n\ port=$db_port/g" $my_cnf_file
if [ "x$OS" != "x" ] && [ $OS = 'Ubuntu' ]; then # Make sure that MySQL is started service mysql restart else # set up auto-start on booting chkconfig mysqld on # restart mysqld service service mysqld start fi
# this will assign a password for mysql admin user 'root' mysqladmin -u $db_root_username password $db_root_password

meta-tag-type.name: OS Family
meta-tag-type.description: Operating System (OS) Family.

supported-os-details.exec-script: trap "APPDEXITSTATUS=\$?;printenv > $2;exit $APPDEXITSTATUS" EXIT # Execute action script source $1 APPDRETURNSTATUS=$? # Unset trap trap - EXIT # Save env variables in output properties file printenv > $2 exit $APPDRETURNSTATUS

bindable-props.description: Number of nodes in the cluster

bindable-props.name: Hostname
bindable-props.description: Add host name or computer name. Use ${random} expression as needed.

script-task.name: Virtual Machine System Report
script-task.description:
System Report is a script task to that can be added to an execution flow in vFabric Application Director on a deployment to create a report of the software and services installed in the machine.
Once this task in added and the application is deployed, the repost can be seen by looking at the deployment execution flow.
The report includes the following:
List of open and listening TCP ports Running process list List of installed packages List of users on the local system Disk mounts Memory usage

#!/bin/bash # Import global conf . $global_conf
export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin set -e
# Tested on CentOS if [ -x /usr/sbin/selinuxenabled ] && /usr/sbin/selinuxenabled; then # SELinux can be disabled by setting "/usr/sbin/setenforce Permissive" echo 'SELinux in enabled on this VM template. This service requires SELinux to be disabled to install successfully' exit 1 fi
if [ "x$OS" != "x" ] && [ $OS = 'Ubuntu' ]; then # Fix the linux-firmware package export DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive apt-get install -y linux-firmware < /dev/console > /dev/console # Install MySQL package apt-get install -y mysql-server else yum --nogpgcheck --noplugins -y install mysql-server fi

#!/bin/bash # Import global conf . $global_conf
export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin set -e
# Locate the my.cnf file my_cnf_file= if [ -f /etc/my.cnf ]; then my_cnf_file=/etc/my.cnf elif [ -f /etc/mysql/my.cnf ]; then my_cnf_file=/etc/mysql/my.cnf fi
if [ "x$my_cnf_file" = "x" ]; then echo "Neither /etc/my.cnf nor /etc/mysql/my.cnf can be found, stopping configuration" exit 1 fi
# update mysql configuration to handle big packets sed -ie "s/\[mysqld\]/\[mysqld\]\n\ max_allowed_packet=1024M/g" $my_cnf_file # update listening port sed -ie "s/\[mysqld\]/\[mysqld\]\n\ port=$db_port/g" $my_cnf_file
if [ "x$OS" != "x" ] && [ $OS = 'Ubuntu' ]; then # Make sure that MySQL is started service mysql restart else # set up auto-start on booting chkconfig mysqld on # restart mysqld service service mysqld start fi
# this will assign a password for mysql admin user 'root' mysqladmin -u $db_root_username password $db_root_password

task.content:
#!/bin/bash # Import global conf . $global_conf
export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin set -e
# Tested on CentOS if [ -x /usr/sbin/selinuxenabled ] && /usr/sbin/selinuxenabled; then # SELinux can be disabled by setting "/usr/sbin/setenforce Permissive" echo 'SELinux in enabled on this VM template. This service requires SELinux to be disabled to install successfully' exit 1 fi
if [ "x$OS" != "x" ] && [ $OS = 'Ubuntu' ]; then # Fix the linux-firmware package export DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive apt-get install -y linux-firmware < /dev/console > /dev/console # Install MySQL package apt-get install -y mysql-server else yum --nogpgcheck --noplugins -y install mysql-server fi

#!/bin/bash # Import global conf . $global_conf
export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin set -e
# Locate the my.cnf file my_cnf_file= if [ -f /etc/my.cnf ]; then my_cnf_file=/etc/my.cnf elif [ -f /etc/mysql/my.cnf ]; then my_cnf_file=/etc/mysql/my.cnf fi
if [ "x$my_cnf_file" = "x" ]; then echo "Neither /etc/my.cnf nor /etc/mysql/my.cnf can be found, stopping configuration" exit 1 fi
# update mysql configuration to handle big packets sed -ie "s/\[mysqld\]/\[mysqld\]\n\ max_allowed_packet=1024M/g" $my_cnf_file # update listening port sed -ie "s/\[mysqld\]/\[mysqld\]\n\ port=$db_port/g" $my_cnf_file
if [ "x$OS" != "x" ] && [ $OS = 'Ubuntu' ]; then # Make sure that MySQL is started service mysql restart else # set up auto-start on booting chkconfig mysqld on # restart mysqld service service mysqld start fi
# this will assign a password for mysql admin user 'root' mysqladmin -u $db_root_username password $db_root_password

script-task.name: Virtual Machine System Report_Virtual_Machine_System_Report_Custom_task_AH
script-task.description:
System Report is a script task to that can be added to an execution flow in vFabric Application Director on a deployment to create a report of the software and services installed in the machine.
Once this task in added and the application is deployed, the repost can be seen by looking at the deployment execution flow.
The report includes the following:
List of open and listening TCP ports Running process list List of installed packages List of users on the local system Disk mounts Memory usage

ns8:component-version-script.script:
#!/bin/bash # Import global conf . $global_conf
export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin set -e
# Locate the my.cnf file my_cnf_file= if [ -f /etc/my.cnf ]; then my_cnf_file=/etc/my.cnf elif [ -f /etc/mysql/my.cnf ]; then my_cnf_file=/etc/mysql/my.cnf fi
if [ "x$my_cnf_file" = "x" ]; then echo "Neither /etc/my.cnf nor /etc/mysql/my.cnf can be found, stopping configuration" exit 1 fi
# update mysql configuration to handle big packets sed -ie "s/\[mysqld\]/\[mysqld\]\n\ max_allowed_packet=1024M/g" $my_cnf_file # update listening port sed -ie "s/\[mysqld\]/\[mysqld\]\n\ port=$db_port/g" $my_cnf_file
if [ "x$OS" != "x" ] && [ $OS = 'Ubuntu' ]; then # Make sure that MySQL is started service mysql restart else # set up auto-start on booting chkconfig mysqld on # restart mysqld service service mysqld start fi
# this will assign a password for mysql admin user 'root' mysqladmin -u $db_root_username password $db_root_password

task.content:
#!/bin/bash # Import global conf . $global_conf
export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin set -e
# Tested on CentOS if [ -x /usr/sbin/selinuxenabled ] && /usr/sbin/selinuxenabled; then # SELinux can be disabled by setting "/usr/sbin/setenforce Permissive" echo 'SELinux in enabled on this VM template. This service requires SELinux to be disabled to install successfully' exit 1 fi
if [ "x$OS" != "x" ] && [ $OS = 'Ubuntu' ]; then # Fix the linux-firmware package export DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive apt-get install -y linux-firmware < /dev/console > /dev/console # Install MySQL package apt-get install -y mysql-server else yum --nogpgcheck --noplugins -y install mysql-server fi

script-task.name: Virtual Machine System Report
script-task.description:
System Report is a script task to that can be added to an execution flow in vFabric Application Director on a deployment to create a report of the software and services installed in the machine.
Once this task in added and the application is deployed, the repost can be seen by looking at the deployment execution flow.
The report includes the following:
List of open and listening TCP ports Running process list List of installed packages List of users on the local system Disk mounts Memory usage

task.content:
#!/bin/bash # Import global conf . $global_conf
export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin set -e
# Locate the my.cnf file my_cnf_file= if [ -f /etc/my.cnf ]; then my_cnf_file=/etc/my.cnf elif [ -f /etc/mysql/my.cnf ]; then my_cnf_file=/etc/mysql/my.cnf fi
if [ "x$my_cnf_file" = "x" ]; then echo "Neither /etc/my.cnf nor /etc/mysql/my.cnf can be found, stopping configuration" exit 1 fi
# update mysql configuration to handle big packets sed -ie "s/\[mysqld\]/\[mysqld\]\n\ max_allowed_packet=1024M/g" $my_cnf_file # update listening port sed -ie "s/\[mysqld\]/\[mysqld\]\n\ port=$db_port/g" $my_cnf_file
if [ "x$OS" != "x" ] && [ $OS = 'Ubuntu' ]; then # Make sure that MySQL is started service mysql restart else # set up auto-start on booting chkconfig mysqld on # restart mysqld service service mysqld start fi
# this will assign a password for mysql admin user 'root' mysqladmin -u $db_root_username password $db_root_password
